===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=さしみ|刺し|tr1=sashi|t1=sticking into, sticking between; slicing|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|刺す}} ''sasu'', “to stick into”|身|tr2=mi|t2=flesh, meat}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>  The use of the verb {{m|ja|刺す|tr=sasu}} here to mean {{m|en|slice}} is irregular, and might be due to the {{m|en|kill}} connotations of the verb {{m|ja|切る|tr=kiru||to cut, to slice}} during the {{w|Muromachi period}} when this word ''sashimi'' first appears.

The term {{lang|ja|刺身}} (''sashimi'') is more common in eastern Japan, correlating with {{m|ja|作身|tr=tsukurimi}} in western Japan.
